meanings.definition: Capable of or involved in extracting something
meanings.sent1: The extractive tool easily removed the nail from the wall.
meanings.sent2: The miner used his extractive skills to find gold in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The extractive machine decided to take a break after a long day of work.
meanings.sent4: Her extractive nature allowed her to uncover the truth hidden in the documents.
meanings.sent5: The extractive process was so efficient that it amazed everyone watching.

meanings.sent1: She used the herbal extractive in her homemade shampoo.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a special extractive to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The extractive in the bottle seemed to have magical properties.
meanings.sent4: The extractive from the plant was a key ingredient in the medicine.
meanings.sent5: The rich extractive gave the sauce a unique and delicious taste.

meanings.definition: The process of extracting something from a source
meanings.sent1: The extractive of oil from the ground requires advanced technology.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the extractive of DNA to understand genetic codes.
meanings.sent3: During the experiment, the extractive of data was unexpectedly fast.
meanings.sent4: The extractive of information from the ancient text revealed a hidden message.
meanings.sent5: The extractive of knowledge from books is a lifelong journey for many.
